page.title: 12Fishing The Thames.
page.content: The Thames is a good river to fish in some parts of the county. I fish at Sutton pools, the upper and lower moors (Culham) and Culham lock cut. The main fish caught here are bream, chub, perch, pike, roach, dace, bleak, gudgeon, daddy ruff and barbel. Along the lower moors the best catches are barbel. These fish range from 2 lb to 12 lb but are difficult to catch. It is best to use swimfeeded luncheon meat as bait. (Swimfeeding means using a special bait which is not on the hook itself.) On the upper moors it is best to use a swimfeed to catch the most fish. Many small fish are also caught here. You can not fish some of the lock cut until later in the year. It is best to fish this area on leger, swimfeeder or float. A roach pole is also useful depending on the current.
